doc.field: Adler & Neilson Iron Work Company architectural drawings
Adler & Neilson Iron Work Company architectural drawings

"Miscellaneous": Letters, Cast Iron Pickets, Lanterns, Ornamental Brackets, circa 1920s-1930s; Floating Dry Dock in Trinidad, 1942; Coney Island Parachute Jump Tower, 1944; Aviation Facilities in Trinidad, 1941; Canal Zone Coco Solo and Balboa C2 Trinidad, 1941; Firestone Rubber, World's Fair, 1938-39; Swift Exhibit, World's Fair, 1939; Westinghouse Electric Manufacturing, 1938; 71 Park Ave., 1923; Museum of French Art, East 60th St., 1932; Revillon Freras, West 30th St., 1935; Chevrolet, Tarrytown, 1935; Apartment house, East 72nd St., 1927; Stevens Institute, Hoboken, NJ, 1943; Grumman Aircraft, Bethpage, NY, 1942
